intro: Gomphrena trinervosa, commonly known as the pink plume or red plume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, feathery inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. Gomphrena trinervosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
